In light of the Governorâ€™s announcement, Tuckahoe Schools will now be closed through May 15, 2020, although this could be extended. This includes all before, during and after school activities. Please click here for further details and updates including information on the free and reduced meal program.","dateStart":"2020-03-10T19:57:15Z","baseGroupName":"Tuckahoe Union Free School District","hash":"hDOS8fdU2eBygavukaVO4E+jt4ut7zjgWoEv8LSRTWw=","updateDate":"2020-04-16T22:04:56Z"}];

a.span: TAX SAVINGS FOR SENIOR CITIZENS & HOMEOWNERS
NYSED COMMON CORE RESOURCES FOR PARENTS AND FAMILIES
CHILD CARE FOR FIRST RESPONDERS & MEDICAL PROVIDERS

div.p: Please click to read updates from the Interim Superintendent of Schools here.
The Tuckahoe Union Free School District Board of Education has completed its superintendent search. Click here to read more about the appointment of Ms. Amy Goodman as the Superintendent of Schools.

p.span: April is Autism Awareness month and we want to raise not only awareness but acceptance.Â We light our schools up blue as we salute our students and their families!

div.h3: 2020-21 Transportation Application to Non-Public Schools Deadline Extended

div.p: 2020-21 Transportation Application to Non-Public Schools Deadline Extended to April 15, 2020. Click here to view more information and form.

The Tuckahoe Union Free School District Annual Budget Vote and Trustee Election for two (2) seats on the Board of Education will be held on Tuesday, May 19, 2020 from 6am to 9pm. Click here to read more.
Tuckahoe Union Free School District offers residents without children in our schools the ability to receive emails with information that may be of interest to them. Click here to learn more.
For the most recent information on capital project, please click here.

img.span: CHILD CARE FOR FIRST RESPONDERS & MEDICAL PROVIDERS

div.p: The installation of the new turf field was completed at TMS/THS this summer.
Tuckahoe High School has earned the distinction of Recognition School forÂ high academic achievement, growth, graduation rate and progress from the New York State Department of Education.

img.alt: board members and administrators posing with shovels

div.p: A groundbreaking ceremony on June 27th kicked off construction on the district's capital project.Â
Students enjoy a sunny day in the TMS/THS reading garden!Â
THS students peruse higher education offerings at the annual college fair.

img.alt: students playing instruments and sitting in bleachers

div.p: Tuckahoe Marching Band and students support TUFSD's student athletes at the homecoming pep rally.
Congratulations to the varsity football team on competing at State semifinals!

img.alt: students in costumes marching and watching parade

div.p: Tuckahoe High School seniors helped the Cottle Cubs celebrate Halloween in the annual Rag-a-Muffin parade.
Students learn about social interactions with Cottle's new Guidance Counselor, Ms. McKinley.
Congratulations to our students whose artwork was chosen to be featured in the START 2020 Regional Art Exhibition at Concordia College!
TMS Geography students have been creating documentary trailers using image and sound to tell stories about geographic features they studied.
THS College acceptances are rolling in and on display in Tuckahoe tradition!
